tool.name: AutomaticRAPIDfileGenerator

param.name: rapid_file_Location
param.dialogReference: This is the folder where the completed files will be output to.

param.name: Watershed_Boundaries_FC
param.dialogReference: This is the HydroBASINS feature class stored in a File Geodatabase with the RegionName field added manually.

param.name: Input_DEM_Location
param.dialogReference:
This is the input folder with the 3 Seconds BIL hydraulically conditioned HydroSHEDS DEM files are stored.

WARNING: Make sure you have all of the DEM files you need. Otherwise, there will be gaps in the watershed.

param.name: Input_Flow_Location
param.dialogReference:
This is the input folder with the 3 Seconds BIL HydroSHEDS flow direction files are stored.

WARNING: Make sure you have all of the flow direction files you need. Otherwise, there will be gaps in the watershed or other errors.

param.name: Number_of_cells_to_define_stream
param.displayname: Number of Cells to Define Stream
param.dialogReference: This is the number of cells to define a stream.

param.name: Buffer_Option
param.dialogReference: This will add a 20 Kilomenter buffer to your area of interest.

param.name: Input_Reservoir
param.dialogReference: This is a shapefile of reservoirs for your area. If included, it will set your Muskingum X value to "0" where it intersects the stream network.

tool.summary:
This tool is used to batch process the HydroSHEDS data based on the HydroBASINS shapefiles with the RegionName attribute added manually. The output is all of the files required for the Streamflow Prediction Tool (SPT)

More information about the SPT can be found here:

Snow, Alan D., Scott D. Christensen, Nathan R. Swain, E. James Nelson, Daniel P. Ames, Norman L. Jones, Deng Ding, Nawajish S. Noman, Cedric H. David, Florian Pappenberger, and Ervin Zsoter, 2016. A High-Resolution National-Scale Hydrologic Forecast System from a Global Ensemble Land Surface Model. Journal of the American Water Resources Association (JAWRA) 1-15, DOI: 10.1111/1752-1688.12434

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool is used to batch process the HydroSHEDS data based on the HydroBASINS shapefiles with the RegionName attribute added manually. The output is all of the files required for the Streamflow Prediction Tool (SPT)

More information about the SPT can be found here:

A High-Resolution National-Scale Hydrologic Forecast System from a Global Ensemble Land Surface Model. Journal of the American Water Resources Association (JAWRA) 1-15, DOI: 10.1111/1752-1688.12434
